info.title: Order API
info.description: This is a short description of the Order API

get.description:
Get Orders by specifying multiple filter query parameters.

Each value(s) must be prefixed with a valid search operator [eq, ne, gt, gte, lt, lte, in, nin]. See examples in some query parameters.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Filter by contact infos created by

parameters.name: datedServiceJourneyId
parameters.description: Filter by Leg with Dated Service Journey ID

parameters.name: distributionChannelId
parameters.description: Filter by Distribution Channel used when Order was created

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Filter by the endTime of one of the Legs on the Order

parameters.name: fromStopPlaceId
parameters.description: Filter by Leg with from Stop Place ID

parameters.name: lastConfirmedAt
parameters.description: Filter by when an Order was last confirmed

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Sorts the result based on a field in the Order objects

parameters.name: orderLineExternalReference
parameters.description: Filter by order lines external reference

parameters.name: originalDatedServiceJourneyId
parameters.description: Filter by Leg with Original Dated Service Journey ID

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Filter by POS header used when Order was created

parameters.name: reservationId
parameters.description: Filter by Reservation ID on OrderLines

parameters.name: serviceJourneyId
parameters.description: Filter by Leg with Service Journey ID

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sorts the result ascending or descending

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Filter by the startTime of one of the Legs on the Order

parameters.name: toStopPlaceId
parameters.description: Filter by Leg with to Stop Place ID

post.summary: Create an empty Order, and return the Order object
post.description: By calling this endpoint, a new, empty Order will be created. The Order ID can then be used to modify the Order to add journeys, etc.

get.summary: Get Order with ID in latest version
get.description: Get the latest versioned Order. Earlier versions with status CONFIRMED can be retrieved by specifying version=<desired version, minimum 1>.

put.description: Update one or multiple values on an Order.

post.description: Unlock order if it is locked.
Manually confirm Orders where the balance is equal to 0.00

delete.description: Delete Fee with specified ID from Order with specified ID

post.description: This endpoint adds a list of OrderLines to the specified Order, and returns a List<OrderLine> of the OrderLines added. If the Order does not exist it will throw an exception.

delete.description: This endpoint removes a list of OrderLines from the specified Order. This is equivalent of running multiple DELETE /v1/orders/{orderId}/orderlines/{orderLineId}

put.description: This endpoint updates OrderLines on the specified Order, and returns the updated representations

post.description: The cost of the OrderLine will be removed from the Order total, and the field `cancellation` will be set to `CANCELLED`. Only to be used for CONFIRMED OrderLines. Typical usage: refunding.

parameters.name: effectiveCancellationDate
parameters.description: This parameter is used to override cancellation date from current timestamp. This will be applied to every order line in the request. Separate requests are required per cancellation date.

put.description: This endpoint updates a OrderLine on the specified Order, and returns an updated representation

delete.description: This endpoint removes an OrderLine from the specified Order. Note that this should only be used for non-confirmed OrderLines. If the OrderLine has been confirmed, it needs to be cancelled instead. Typical usage: customer has decided not to purchase the OrderLine.

post.description: The cost of the OrderLine will be removed from the Order total, and the field `cancellation` will be set to `CANCELLED`. Only to be used for CONFIRMED OrderLines. Typical usage: refunding.

parameters.name: effectiveCancellationDate
parameters.description: This parameter is used to override cancellation date from current timestamp.

post.description: Add seat Reservation references to the specified Order. Reservation ID is an UUID

post.summary: Reset Order to the latest confirmed version, or initial state if it has never been confirmed
post.description: This can be used when customers spend too much time placing an Order with a seat Reservation. By using reset, the application will free up space so that the seats can be reserved by others.
This endpoint adds a Traveller to the specified Order, and returns the Traveller that was added. If the Order does not exist, it will throw an exception.

put.description: This endpoint updates a Traveller for the specified Order, and returns the Traveller that was updated. If either the Order or the Traveller does not exist, it will throw an exception.

delete.description: This endpoint removes a Traveller from the specified Order. If either the Order or the Traveller does not exist, it will throw an exception.

dciHeader.name: Entur-Distribution-Channel
dciHeader.description: A header containing the distribution channel ID.

paginationPageParam.name: page
paginationPageParam.description: Selects a specific page in the collection

paginationPerPageParam.name: perPage
paginationPerPageParam.description: Selects the number of elements per page

locked.description: Order is locked and cannot be edited.

CancellationReason.title: CancellationReason
CancellationReason.description: Cancellation reason for an OrderLine. OrderLines with REPLACED have been replaced with a newer version.

ContactInfo.title: ContactInfo

createdBy.description: Reference to the Customer who created this entity

contact.description: Reference to the Customer listed as contact for this entity

ContactInfo.description: Contact information related to different aspects in the lifecycle of an Order.

DynamicUsageValidityPeriod.title: DynamicUsageValidityPeriod
DynamicUsageValidityPeriod.description: A dynamic UsageValidtyPeriod that is generated on the fly. Thus lacking id and version as it can not be referenced

standardDuration.description: Standard duration. Represented as a string formatted according to ISO-8601

activationMeans.description: Activation Means. Describes how a product can be activated.

DistributionDetails.title: DistributionDetails

fulfillmentMethodRef.description: Reference to the FulfillmentMethod used to fulfill the Order, ie via conductor using MT receipt, TVM via NOD QR or TravelCard, mobile phone via NOD QR code or ID-based - etc

typeOfTravelDocumentToIssueRef.description: Reference to the type of TravelDocument that will be issued

customerAccountRef.description: Reference to an id based customer account

DistributionDetails.description: Wrapper for references connected to distribution of travel rights and/or tickets

startStopPointRef.description: Reference to the staring stop point

endStopPointRef.description: Reference to the ending stop point

Entitlement.title: Entitlement

contractId.description: ID of contract used by Traveller for OrderLine

entitlementProductRef.description: Reference to the EntitlementProduct used when calculating the price

externalEntitlementRef.description: External reference to this Entitlement in third party systems

Entitlement.description: Information about the product and contract used when generating offer

FeeRequest.title: FeeRequest

type.description: Type of Fee. Valid types: MANUAL, REFUNDING, ONBOARD, CHANGE, INVOICE, CHANGE_NON_REFUNDABLE, PENALTY, BOOKING, REDUCTION

externalRef.description: External reference to this Fee in external systems

reason.description: Explanatory text describing the reason for the Fee, if applicable

orderLineIds.description: References to the OrderLines this Fee refers to, if applicable. If empty, the fee refers to all order lines

orderVersion.description: The version of the Order this Fee is added to

linkedByExtRef.description: Used to identify fees originated from external systems

FeeRequest.description: Fee related to one or more OrderLines

Fee.title: Fee

id.description: ID used to uniquely identify Fee if deletion is necessary

Fee.description: Fee related to one or more OrderLines

staySeated.description: Passengers should remain seated when travelling from and to ServiceJourneys referenced in this object

fromServiceJourneyRef.description: Reference to the ServiceJourney the passengers are changing from

toServiceJourneyRef.description: Reference to the ServiceJourney the passengers are changing to

derivedFromObjectRef.description: Identity of object from which this object of ENTITY was derived. Normally the same.

derivedFromVersionRef.description: Version of this object from which this version of ENTITY was derived.

SubMode.description: The transport sub mode (e.g., localBus or expressBus) used when traversing this leg. Null if leg is not a ride

Order.title: Order

version.description:
The system increments an Orders version number whenever some change occurs that causes the Orders status to go from CONFIRMED to DRAFT.
The user has to perform an action that causes the status to go from DRAFT to CONFIRMED (such as paying for the Order) before the time given in expireAt. If the Order is not confirmed within this time, the system will scrap all changes (including the incremented version) and return the Order to its last confirmed version.

totalAmount.description: The total amount due for this Order.

balance.description: The balance amount for this Order.

totalTaxAmount.description: The total tax amount for this Order.

paymentRefs.description: Payment references used on this Order.

reservations.description: Seating Reservations connected to this Order.

organisationId.description: ID of the organisation which created/sold this Order.

createdAt.description: Timestamp for when Order was created.

lastConfirmedAt.description: Timestamp for when Order was last confirmed.

pos.description: Point-of-sale reference of request used when when Order was created

distributionChannelId.description: Distribution channel ID of request used when when Order was created

Order.description: A purchase Order for one or more Travellers

OrderCreateRequest.title: OrderCreateRequest
OrderCreateRequest.description: Optional configuration to use when creating an Order

expireAt.description: Any changes not confirmed before this point in time will be discarded. Default is 20 minutes from the last operation. Cannot be in the past, or further into the future than six months.

OrderRequest.title: OrderRequest

expireAt.description: Any changes not confirmed before this point in time will be discarded. Default is 20 minutes from the last operation. Cannot be in the past, or further into the future than six months.

OrderRequest.description: A purchase Order for one or more Travellers

version.description: Version of this OrderLine. This is iterated when the OrderLine is updated, but not when it is replaced.

createdAt.description: Timestamp for when the OrderLine was created.

lastConfirmedAt.description: Timestamp for when the OrderLine was last confirmed.

refunded.description: If true = refunded, false = cancelled, null = active

id.description: Id for an OrderLine, required when updating orderLines

fareProducts.description: The underlying FareProducts which make up this SalesPackage.

travellers.description: The Travellers that are to travel on this OrderLine.

externalReference.description: External reference to another system supplied by the client.

effectiveCancellationDate.description: If set, the effective date for cancellation. Overrides timestamp.

clientProvidedData.description: A map of client provided data. No validation is performed, and no guarantee can be made about its contents.

OrganisationRef.title: OrganisationRef

privateCode.description: Private code used to reference an Organisation

OrganisationRef.description: The Organisation that owns the FareProduct

PageOfOrder.title: PageOfOrder

totalPages.description: Total number of pages available to browse

PageOfOrder.description: Page displays a subset of a list of entities

orderVersion.description: Order version number this Payment confirmed.

amount.description: The Payment amount. Maximum (totalDigits: 18, fractionDigits: 5) according to ISO 20022.

completedAt.description: Timestamp for when Payment was completed

settlementId.description: Supplied to the client by an external system for handling settlements. For Internal Entur Clients this is Enturs Electronic Journal.

PointToPointValidity.title: PointToPointValidity
PointToPointValidity.description: Start and StopPlaces where the entity is valid

PriceWithTax.title: PriceWithTax

taxRate.description: Tax rate. Must be in valid BigDecimal format

taxCode.description: Tax code for this tax rate

PriceWithTax.description: Price with included tax amounts and an optional rate.

PurchasedAccommodation.title: PurchasedAccommodation
PurchasedAccommodation.description: Type of accommodation chosen by customer

PurchasedDiscountUsageParameters.title: PurchasedDiscountUsageParameters

reserving.description: Reference to reserving parameters with price information.

entitlementGiven.description: Reference to entitlement products used when calculating price

PurchasedDiscountUsageParameters.description: Possible additional parameters for the configurations

PurchasedFareClass.title: PurchasedFareClass
PurchasedFareClass.description: Type of FareClass chosen by customer

PurchasedFareProduct.title: PurchasedFareProduct

fareProductRef.description: Reference to the FareProduct described here

legIds.description: The IDs of the Legs that are connected to this FareProduct.

validableElements.description: The ValidableElement configurations which makes up this FareProduct.

originatingFromProductId.description: The ID of the entitlement product that allowed the sale discount right to be used

elementId.description: Unique ID for this specific PurchasedFareProduct. Note that this ID is only for distinguishing parts of an orderLine. It has no use outside of the orderLine, and can't be found in any other service.

validityId.description: Unique identifier for a purchased FareProduct with validity

PurchasedFareProduct.description: Configuration for a purchased Fare Product

PurchasedFareProductValidity.title: PurchasedFareProductValidity

validityId.description: Unique identifier for a purchased FareProduct with validity

PurchasedFareProductValidity.description: The PointToPontValidity or ZonalValidity this FareProduct contains.

fareStructureElementRef.description: Reference to the FareStructureElement described here

legIds.description: The Leg IDs that are connected to this FareStructureElement

qualityStructureFactorRef.description: Reference to the QualityStructureFactor for this FareStructureElement

elementId.description: Unique ID for this specific PurchasedFareStructureElement. Note that this ID is only for distinguishing parts of an orderLine. It has no use outside of the orderLine, and can't be found in any other service.

PurchasedGeographicalInterval.title: PurchasedGeographicalInterval

distance.description: The distance in the geographical interval.

zoneCount.description: Number of zones counted for the journey.

zones.description: The Zones for which the journey passes through. Deprecated. This list will be empty when tariff zones are fully replaced by fare zones.

fareZones.description: A list of fare zones that exist in this interval. Empty if not relevant.

PurchasedGeographicalInterval.description: The Geographical Interval with distance and zone data.

userProfileRefs.description: The UserProfile IDs that are given rights to travel with this GroupTicket.

groupSummary.description: A collection of all the different user profiles with price and tax in the group.

PurchasedLeg.title: PurchasedLeg

startTime.description: The date and time this Leg begins.

fromStopPlaceRef.description: Reference to the StopPlace the Leg starts at

endTime.description: The date and time this Leg ends.

toStopPlaceRef.description: Reference to the StopPlace the Leg ends at

authorityRef.description: Reference to the Authority owning the material the ServiceJourney uses

operatorRef.description: Reference to the Organisation that operates the Line the Leg belongs to

interchangeTo.description: Information about whether this Leg is connected to another Leg without changing material

PurchasedLeg.description: Part of a trip between two places.

PurchasedParameters.title: PurchasedParameters

luggageAllowance.description: Reference to luggage allowance parameters with price information.

exchanging.description: Reference to exchanging parameters with price information.

reserving.description: Reference to reserving parameters with price information.

replacing.description: Reference to replacing parameters with price information.

roundTrip.description: Reference to round trip parameters with price information.

entitlementGiven.description: Reference to entitlement products used when calculating price

PurchasedParameters.description: Possible additional parameters for the configurations

purchasedFareClasses.description: Type of FareClass chosen by customer

purchasedAccommodations.description: Type of accommodation chosen by customer

reservationId.description: ID and version of the Reservation.

datedServiceJourneyRef.description: Reference to the DatedServiceJourney the Reservation belongs to

discountRightRef.description: Reference to the SaleDiscountRight used when calculating the price

discountParameters.description: Reference to the DiscountUsageParameters used when calculating the price

originatingFromProductId.description: The ID of the EntitlementProduct that allowed the SaleDiscountRight to be used.

entitlements.description: Entitlement information for the customer and the OrderLine

PurchasedUsageParameter.title: PurchasedUsageParameter
PurchasedUsageParameter.description: A simple representation of a UsageParameter

PurchasedUserProfile.title: PurchasedUserProfile

typeOfConcession.description: The type of concession for this UserProfile

PurchasedUserProfile.description: A representation of a user profile

PurchasedUserProfileSummary.title: PurchasedUserProfileSummary
PurchasedUserProfileSummary.description: A representation of a user profile to summarize parts of a purchased group. Multiply `count` with `priceContribution` to get sum of all user profiles of same type.

count.description: The number of travellers with given user profile.

legIds.description: The Leg IDs that are connected to this ValidableElement.

fareStructureElements.description: The underlying FareStructureElement configurations which makes up this ValidableElement

elementId.description: Unique ID for this specific PurchasedValidableElement. Note that this ID is only for distinguishing parts of an orderLine. It has no use outside of the orderLine, and can't be found in any other service.

occurs.description: The number of instances of this particular type of ValidableElement that is collected in this FareProduct

RefType.title: RefType

version.description: A specific version of the resource if applicable

RefType.description: Reference to a resource available in a different APIs

SpecialOrderCause.title: SpecialOrderCause

causeCode.description: The cause code for issuing the Order.

organisationId.description: The organisation responsible for the cause. Eg. the Operator responsible for the delay causing a zero ticket to be issued. Should not be confused with the organisationId of the Order, as this has no correlation.

SpecialOrderCause.description: Holder for fields used to explain why an Order has been issued. Used for zero tickets.

value.description: A text to describe the contents of this OrderLine

travelDocumentRef.description: A reference to a type of TravelDocument

distributionAction.description: Depicts an action to be taken for the TravelDocument

legs.description: The Legs of a planned travel route. Only Legs which are rides are expected to be added.

placesInJourney.description: The StopPlaces the product is valid between. The first element in this array will be the StopPlace the Traveller is travelling from, and the second element will be the StopPlace the Traveller is travelling to. There will never be more than two elements in this array.

aimedStartTime.description: Timestamp used when determining the beginning of the ticket's validity. Taken from the offer used by the end user when ordering the ticket. Note that the fallback timestamp is the timestamp at which the orderLine was added to the Order.

aimedEndTime.description: Timestamp used when determining the end of the ticket's validity. Taken from the offer used by the end user when ordering the ticket. No fallback, null if not available on offer.

TravellerRequest.title: TravellerRequest
TravellerRequest.description: A Traveller object which might hold a reference to a Customer

Traveller.title: Traveller
Traveller.description: A Traveller object which might hold a reference to a Customer

WorkflowStatus.title: WorkflowStatus
WorkflowStatus.description: Status of this Order or OrderLine. Every Order starts out with the status DRAFT, and can only be changed to CONFIRMED when it is balanced - when balance is '0.00'. All OrderLines that are have the status DRAFT at that point in time can also be changed to CONFIRMED.

ZonalValidity.title: ZonalValidity

zones.description: Valid in zones. Deprecated. This list will be empty when tariff zones are fully replaced by fare zones.

ZonalValidity.description: Zones where the product is valid
